channel.title: few questions virtualbox (Whonix LXDE)
channel.description:
I'm using virtualbox .ova images. I installed LXDE on Whonix-Workstation. And i got few questions.
I did "sudo service --status-all" and i get the fallowing output... https://anonfile.com/2a25Oaj7b2/services_png Question why tor service is running on my workstation ? I tough tor runs only in gateway?
Next thing. After i installed LXDE i checked lxsession settings and got output like this... https://anonfile.com/ud4cObjfbe/lxsession_png First question why spicevdagent is in startup ? It's virtualbox not kvm, why .ova image contain such thing ? Second question. It's not whonix related, but i hope to get answer here.. On lxsession screenshot there is services that is checked for startup, but no name of the service, how i can find the names of these BLANK entries ?

item.title: few questions virtualbox (Whonix LXDE)
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Currently unsupported.

Whonix

Unsupported

What do you mean by unsupported?

See also:

Whonix

Other Desktop Environments

How to use Other Desktop Environments other than KDE with Whonix. Current situation. Risks. Future.

In future, Whonix might provide XFCE builds.

Whonix

Stay Tuned

Stay up-to-date on the latest Whonix news

virtualbox1:

First question why spicevdagent is in startup ? It’s virtualbox not kvm, why .ova image contain such thing ?

No adverse effects. Reduced development workload.

Read full topic

item.title: few questions virtualbox (Whonix LXDE)
item.dc:creator: virtualbox1
item.description:
I’m using virtualbox .ova images. I installed LXDE on Whonix-Workstation. And i got few questions.

I did “sudo service --status-all” and i get the fallowing output…
https://anonfile.com/2a25Oaj7b2/services_png
Question why tor service is running on my workstation ? I tough tor runs only in gateway?

Next thing. After i installed LXDE i checked lxsession settings and got output like this…
https://anonfile.com/ud4cObjfbe/lxsession_png
First question why spicevdagent is in startup ? It’s virtualbox not kvm, why .ova image contain such thing ?
Second question. It’s not whonix related, but i hope to get answer here… On lxsession screenshot there is services that is checked for startup, but no name of the service, how i can find the names of these BLANK entries ?

Read full topic
